intro: Albuca bakeri, commonly known as the Baker's albuca, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, sword-shaped leaves and clusters of white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is a succulent plant, capable of storing water in its leaves, making it relatively drought-tolerant. Albuca bakeri is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is popular in rock gardens and as a container plant.
